results.title: Helicobacter pylori-mediated gastric pathogenesis is attenuated by treatment of 2-deoxyglucose and metformin.
results.text_hl: As a result, indicators of gastric pathogenesis by @DISEASE_Helicobacter_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D016481 @@@H. pylori infection@@@ including infiltration of polymorphonuclear neutrophils and lymphocytes, intestinal @<m>DISEASE_Metaplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008679 @@@metaplasia@@@, @DISEASE_Atrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D001284 @@@atrophy@@@, and proliferation of gastric epithelial cells were attenuated by short-term administration of @CHEMICAL_Deoxyglucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003847 @@@2DG@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@, or Combi.

citations.NLM: Su H, Bak EJ, Kim A, Tissera K, Cha JH, Jang S. Helicobacter pylori-mediated gastric pathogenesis is attenuated by treatment of 2-deoxyglucose and metformin. J Microbiol. 2022 Aug;60(8):849-858. PMID: 35731346
